events.message: Customer reported a vehicle accident occurred on April 30th involving a collision with another car at an intersection.
The claim was categorized as an auto accident based on keywords referencing a car collision and damages.
An insurance agent was assigned to the customer's case to manage all communications and support claim processing.
The customer received formal acknowledgment of the claim submission along with details about the next steps.
Request sent to customer for supporting documentation including police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and driver license.
Customer uploaded all requested documents such as the police report, accident photos, and personal identification successfully.
The insurance investigation team began reviewing the submitted evidence and contacted witnesses to confirm accident details.
Investigation concluded with verification of liability confirming the other party was at fault in the collision.
A settlement amount was proposed to the customer reflecting repair costs and loss of use for the damaged vehicle.
Customer responded expressing satisfaction with the quick response and transparency throughout the claim process.
Internal approval was granted to proceed with the settlement following positive customer feedback and thorough investigation.
Payment was successfully issued to the customerâ€™s bank account covering the agreed settlement for vehicle repairs.
The claim was formally closed after payment issuance and confirmation with customer that all concerns were addressed.
The case file was archived in the records system in compliance with company data retention policies for auto accident claims.
